text: Pterocarpus rotundifolius, the round-leaved bloodwood, is a species of fabaceous tree that is native to mesic and well-watered woodlands of Africa south of the equator. ==Subspecies== Up to three subspecies are recognized, but specimens with intermediate characteristics are common. * P. r. subsp. rotundifolius * P. r. subsp. martinii (Dunkley) Mend. & SousaAlso considered synonymous with the nominate subspecies, see: * P. r. subsp. polyanthus (Harms) Mendonca & Sousa ==Gallery== Pterocarpus rotundifolius, saamgestelde blare, Pretoria.jpg|rounded leaflets Pterocarpus rotundifolius, blomme, Pretoria, a.jpg|flowers Pterocarpus rotundifolius, peul, Pretoria.jpg|shape of single pod ==References== Category:Trees of Africa Category:Trees of South Africa rotundifolius
title: Pterocarpus rotundifolius
